It's a hell of a jump. You have to do something, but even with a running start, you think, you could only barely make it. As you start to watch her fall, before you can plot a course of action, you see Andor emerge on the opposite side of the gap. He tosses himself onto his stomach, flat against the edge of the fissure, to catch Tatsumaki with one hand. But now, he's starting to slide off, too.

Then, you get the distraction you're looking for. Kainzo and Nel are next to meet the Artificer, and he's a match for both of them, holding them at bay as swords and daggers clash with armored gauntlets. He's ignoring Vyx's shots from the opposite end of the clearing; she's having enough trouble aiming as it is. You look back at the gap, with Andor, Tatsumaki, and Ayla all on the cusp of falling, and wonder how long those two can duel Kjorikos, even injured as he appears.

“Aelriss!” You turn, and shout to her, a different fissure now separating the two of you. “I need you to—!”

She's standing frozen, trembling, cut off from you by a growing wall of raging fire.

Only Eunoia joins you, whistling gravely as it lands on your shoulder.
